words.def: adaptive behavior - In behavioral ecology, any behavior which contributes to an individual's reproductive success and is thus subject to the forces of natural selection
words.name: adaptive behavior

words.def: air - see under "atmosphere"
words.name: air

words.def: allee effect - concept in population ecology that describes the positive relation between the size of a given population and its growth
words.name: allee effect

words.def: animal behaviour - see under "ethology"
words.name: animal behaviour

words.def: applied ecology - uses ecological principles and insights to solve environment related problems (includes agroecology and conservation biology)
words.name: applied ecology

words.def: aquatic plants - vascular plants adopted to living in aquatic environments in salt or fresh water
words.name: aquatic plants

words.def: area effect (island biodiversity) - the hypothesis that larger islands are able to support more species than smaller ones
words.name: area effect

words.def: atmosphere - earth's atmosphere is composed of gases and water that are retained by earth's gravity and that help the earth retain heat and reflect UV radiation.
words.name: atmosphere

words.def: autecology - also known as population ecology. It is a major sub field of ecology which deals with the dynamics of species populations and the way in which these populations interact with the environment
words.name: autecology

words.def: autopoïesis (controversial theory)
words.name: autopoïesis

words.def: autotroph - see under "producer"
words.name: autotroph

words.def: behavioral ecology - studies the ecological and evolutionary basis of animal behavior, mainly on the level of the individual
words.name: behavioral ecology

words.def: biodegradable - capable of decaying through the action of living organisms
words.name: biodegradable

words.def: biodiversity - diversity among and within plant and animal species in a given environment
words.name: biodiversity

words.def: biogeochemistry - studies the effect of biota on global chemistry, and on the cycles of matter and energy that transport earth's chemical components in time and space
words.name: biogeochemistry

words.def: biogeochemical cycle - the pathway through which an element, or molecule moves through the atmosphere, hydrosphere, lithosphere, and biosphere
words.name: biogeochemical cycle

words.def: biogeographic realm - see under "ecozone"
words.name: biogeographic realm

words.def: biogeography - the study of the geographic distribution of species on Earth
words.name: biogeography

words.def: bio-invader - non-native species
words.name: bio-invader

words.def: biological magnification - the increase in concentration of a substance in the tissues of organisms at successively higher levels in a food chain
words.name: biological magnification

words.def: biomass - the sum of all living organisms in a given area.
words.name: biomass

words.def: biomass pyramid - or ecological pyramid - a graph that illustrates the productivity in a trophic level
words.name: biomass pyramid

words.def: biome - the total complex of biotic communities occupying and characterizing a particular area
words.name: biome

words.def: biosphere - ('the sphere of life') - the global sum of all ecosystems on Earth
words.name: biosphere

words.def: biota - the total collection of organisms of a geographic region or a time period
words.name: biota

words.def: biotic potential - under ideal conditions, the maximum rate of increase of a population in a given area
words.name: biotic potential

words.def: boreal forest - forest areas of the northern North Temperate Zone, mostly consisting of conifers, called taiga in Siberia
words.name: boreal forest

words.def: camouflage - deceitful inconspicuous appearance, adopted by an organism, used to deceive possible predators or prey
words.name: camouflage

words.def: carbon cycle - the biogeochemical cycle by which carbon is exchanged between the biosphere, pedosphere, geosphere, hydrosphere, and atmosphere of the Earth
words.name: carbon cycle

words.def: carrying capacity - the maximum number of individuals a given environment's resources can support, including the food and water available for that environment
words.name: carrying capacity

words.def: charismatic megafauna - a species of large animal species with widespread popular appeal that environmental activists use to achieve conservation goals well beyond just those species. Examples include the giant panda, the Bengal tiger, and the blue whale. See also: flagship species
words.name: charismatic megafauna

words.def: chemical ecology - the study of the use by organisms of biological (natural) chemicals, for example in defense against predators
words.name: chemical ecology

words.def: climate - the long term average weather pattern in a particular place
words.name: climate

words.def: climate change - change in weather conditions such as cloud cover, wind speed, temperature, rainfall or humidity in a specific region
words.name: climate change

words.def: climax community - a community of plants and animals that has reached a stable state, occurring when the different species are best adapted to average conditions in a given area
words.name: climax community

words.def: commensalism - a symbiotic relationship between two organisms of different species, in which one of the organisms benefits while the other remains unaffected
words.name: commensalism

words.def: community - an assemblage of various organisms living in the same environment
words.name: community

words.def: community ecology (or synecology) - studies the interactions between species within an ecological community
words.name: community ecology

words.def: competition - organisms from the same or from different species competing with each other for food, living conditions, reproductive success, or any limited resource; the most adapted individuals come out on top and thus survive and reproduce
words.name: competition

words.def: competitive exclusion principle - states that two species cannot coexist in the same region if they are competing for exactly the same resources
words.name: competitive exclusion principle

words.def: coniferous forest - one of the main land ("terrestrial") biomes, culminating in the taiga
words.name: coniferous forest

words.def: conservation biology- scientific study of earth's biodiversity that aims at protecting natural habitats and the plant and animal species living in them
words.name: conservation biology

words.def: consumer or heterotroph - an organism, usually an animal, that feeds on plants or other animals
words.name: consumer

words.def: cooperation - the process of organisms working together for mutual benefit
words.name: cooperation

words.def: courtship display - ritual social behavior between possible mates
words.name: courtship display

words.def: deciduous broadleaf forest - any forest, situated in a temperate zone, whose trees shed their leaves during the cold season
words.name: deciduous broadleaf forest

words.def: decomposition - process by which tissues of dead organisms break down into simpler forms of organic matter, thereby clearing the limited available space in a biome
words.name: decomposition

words.def: deep sea community- any community of organisms linked by a shared habitat in the deep sea
words.name: deep sea community

words.def: density dependence - the dependence of the growth rate of a population of a given species on its density
words.name: density dependence

words.def: desert ecology - the sum of interactions between both biotic and abiotic factors that occur in a desert biome, including interactions between plant, animal, and bacterial populations in a desert community.
words.name: desert ecology

words.def: desert - a landscape that receives less than 10 inches of rain per year
words.name: desert

words.def: desertification - a process by which areas become desert-like wastelands with a lower, and different biodiversity
words.name: desertification

words.def: denitrification - breakdown of nitrates (mostly in the soil), by anaerobic bacteria, into their constituent chemical elements: nitrogen and oxygen
words.name: denitrification

words.def: detrital food web - a food web depicting the energy flow from photoautotrophs through detritivores and decomposers
words.name: detrital food web

words.def: detritivore - heterotrophs which consume decomposing bits of organic matter, such as plant litter
words.name: detritivore

words.def: decomposer - organism that breaks down organic matter
words.name: decomposer

words.def: dominance hierarchy - organization of individual organisms into groups with a social structure
words.name: dominance hierarchy

words.def: dominance species - a species which characterizes and dominates an ecological community as measured by its primary productivity or biomass
words.name: dominance species

words.def: ecology - the study of interactions between organisms and their environment
words.name: ecology

words.def: ecological literacy - the ability to understand the natural systems that make life on earth possible
words.name: ecological literacy

words.def: ecological niche - (see under "niche")
words.name: ecological niche

words.def: ecological selection - ecological processes that operate on a species' inherited traits without reference to mating or secondary sex characteristics
words.name: ecological selection

words.def: ecological succession - the change in the species structure of an ecological community over time
words.name: ecological succession

words.def: ecophagy - the destruction of an ecosystem
words.name: ecophagy

words.def: ecophysiology - studies the interaction of the physiological traits of an organism with its abiotic environment
words.name: ecophysiology

words.def: ecopoiesis - hypothetical shaping by human action of a sustainable ecosystem on a currently lifeless, sterile planet
words.name: ecopoiesis

words.def: ecoregion - a region defined by its geography and ecology
words.name: ecoregion

words.def: ecosynthesis - the use of introduced species to fill niches in a disrupted environment with the aim of increasing the speed of ecological restoration
words.name: ecosynthesis

words.def: ecosystem - the total of interacting organisms (biocoenosis) and non-living things (biotope) in a specific environment
words.name: ecosystem

words.def: ecosystem ecology - studies how flows of energy and matter interact with biotic elements of ecosystems
words.name: ecosystem ecology

words.def: ecosystem modeling - the use of mathematics, computer programs and models to understand and predict ecosystem behaviour
words.name: ecosystem modeling

words.def: ecosystem services - resources and processes provided in an ecosystem and which benefit organisms
words.name: ecosystem services

words.def: ecotone - a transition area between two adjacent but different landscape patches
words.name: ecotone

words.def: ecotoxicology - looks at the ecological role of toxic chemicals (often pollutants, but also naturally occurring compounds)
words.name: ecotoxicology

words.def: ecozone - an area hat has characteristics of natural origin such as climate, terrain, vegetation, etc. It is also the largest division of the earth's surface filled with living organisms
words.name: ecozone

words.def: El Niño - a band of anomalously warm ocean water temperatures that occasionally develops off the coast of South America and can cause climatic changes across the Pacific Ocean
words.name: El Niño

words.def: emigration- for an organism, leaving its native community for a new one
words.name: emigration

words.def: endangered species - a species that risks becoming extinct
words.name: endangered species

words.def: energy pyramid - a graphical representation designed to show the biomass or biomass productivity at each trophic level in a given ecosystem
words.name: energy pyramid

words.def: environmental restoration - undoing the damage caused to an area by human activity or by natural disasters
words.name: environmental restoration

words.def: estuary - a body of coastal water, attached to both ocean and river, often coloured black as a result of silt and sediment being carried by the latter
words.name: estuary

words.def: ethology - the study of animal behavior
words.name: ethology

words.def: eutrophication - an increase in natural or chemical nutrients in the ecosystem. This increase of nutrients typically stimulates growth of some aggressive plant species, thereby hampering that of others, and harming biodiversity. In water it may result in hypoxia
words.name: eutrophication

words.def: evaporation - the slow vaporization of water from either the soil o from surface water
words.name: evaporation

words.def: evolutionary ecology - (or ecoevolution) the evolutionary changes occurring to an organism within its population or within the wider community
words.name: evolutionary ecology

words.def: exotic species - an introduced species not native or endemic to a habitat
words.name: exotic species

words.def: extinction - occurs when the last organism of a species has died
words.name: extinction

words.def: extreme environment - environment in which few life forms can survive
words.name: extreme environment

words.def: extremophile - organism that thrives in physically or geochemically extreme conditions
words.name: extremophile

words.def: fall overturn - the mixing (or "turning over") of water occurring in autumn, causing its re-oxygenation
words.name: fall overturn

words.def: fire ecology - scientific discipline that looks at the ecological role of natural fire
words.name: fire ecology

words.def: fixed action pattern - in ethology, an instinctive behaviorial pattern
words.name: fixed action pattern

words.def: flagship species - species chosen to represent an environmental cause, such as an ecosystem in need of conservation
words.name: flagship species

words.def: food chain - a group of organisms interrelated by the fact that each member of the group feeds upon the one below it
words.name: food chain

words.def: food density - the amount of food available in a given ecotope
words.name: food density

words.def: food web - a set of interconnected food chains by which energy and nutrients circulate within an ecosystem
words.name: food web

words.def: foundation species - a species of dominant primary producer in an ecosystem both in terms of abundance and influence
words.name: foundation species

words.def: founder effect - the accumulation of random genetic changes in an isolated population
words.name: founder effect

words.def: functional ecology - the study of the roles, or functions, that certain species (or groups of species) play in an ecosystem
words.name: functional ecology

words.def: functional response - the intake rate of a consumer as a function of "food density" (see above)
words.name: functional response

words.def: fungus - in ecology, along with bacteria, fungi are the major decomposers in most terrestrial (and in some aquatic) ecosystems and therefore play a crucial role in the nutrient cycle
words.name: fungus

words.def: genetic bottleneck - an evolutionary event in which a significant percentage of a population or species is killed or otherwise prevented from reproducing
words.name: genetic bottleneck

words.def: global ecology - see under "macroecology"
words.name: global ecology

words.def: global ecophagy - the destruction of Earth's ecosystem.
words.name: global ecophagy

words.def: global warming - the rise of average temperature of Earth's near-surface air and oceans
words.name: global warming

words.def: grassland - area where the vegetation is dominated by grasses
words.name: grassland

words.def: greenhouse effect - warming of the climate that results from solar irradiance being trapped in the atmosphere, which is caused by gases that allow sunshine to pass through but absorb heat that is radiated back from the warmed surface of the earth
words.name: greenhouse effect

words.def: ground cover - any plant that grows over an area of ground, providing protection of the topsoil from erosion and drought
words.name: ground cover

words.def: guest - the generic term used for parasitic, mutualistic and commensalist symbionts
words.name: guest

words.def: habitat - a specific ecological area that is inhabited by specific plant and animal species
words.name: habitat

words.def: habitat corridors - a strip of land intended to facilitate the movement of wildlife species between disconnected areas of their habitat
words.name: habitat corridors

words.def: habitat fragmentation - environmental change that causes the discontinuation of a species' habitat
words.name: habitat fragmentation

words.def: halophyte - salt loving plant
words.name: halophyte

words.def: halophile - salt loving organism
words.name: halophile

words.def: heath - low-growing woody vegetation found on free-draining acid soils
words.name: heath

words.def: heterotroph see under "consumer"
words.name: heterotroph

words.def: homeostasis - the property of a system by which it regulates its internal environment and maintains a constant and stable condition; e.g. endothermic animals maintaining a constant body temperature
words.name: homeostasis

words.def: host - an organism that harbors a parasitic, a mutualistic or a commensal symbiont
words.name: host

words.def: human ecology - an interdisciplinary study of the relationship between humans and their natural, social and built environments
words.name: human ecology

words.def: hydrologic cycle or water cycle - the cycle or process of evaporation and condensation of water, and its distribution across the earth driven by solar energy
words.name: hydrologic cycle

words.def: hydrophyte - see under "aquatic plant"
words.name: hydrophyte

words.def: hydrosphere - the combined mass of water found on, under and above the surface of the earth
words.name: hydrosphere

words.def: hydrothermal vent - an underwater steaming fissure that has a unique ecosystem
words.name: hydrothermal vent

words.def: hypoxia - reduced oxygen content of air or a body of water, detrimental to aerobic organisms
words.name: hypoxia

words.def: illegitimate receiver - an organism that intercepts a signal intended for another organism, to the fitness detriment of either the signaler or the legitimate receiver of the signal
words.name: illegitimate receiver

words.def: indicator species - any living species that defines a trait or characteristic of the environment; the presence and/or abundance of organisms of these species are an indication of the health of a given ecosystem
words.name: indicator species

words.def: insular biogeography - the unique community of an island
words.name: insular biogeography

words.def: intermediate disturbance hypothesis - a theory that tries to predict how species diversity will change with varying levels of disturbance
words.name: intermediate disturbance hypothesis

words.def: interspecific competition - occurs when different species try to use the same resources in an environment
words.name: interspecific competition

words.def: intertidal zone - periodically immersed coastal area
words.name: intertidal zone

words.def: invasive species - a non-native species whose introduction to an area is likely to cause economic or environmental harm or harm to human health
words.name: invasive species

words.def: ion exchange- a reversible chemical reaction where ions with the same charge are switched; this principle is used in the purification of waste water
words.name: ion exchange

words.def: jungle - a large, undeveloped, humid forest that is home to many wild plants and animals
words.name: jungle

words.def: k-selected species - a species that forms a group of strong competitors in a crowded environment and that has fewer but stronger offspring
words.name: k-selected species

words.def: keystone species - keystone species is a species that has a disproportionate effect on its environment relative to its abundance. Such species affect many other organisms in an ecosystem and help to determine the types and numbers of various others species in a community.
words.name: keystone species

words.def: La Niña - counterpart of El Niño
words.name: La Niña

words.def: lake - an inland body of water, localized in a basin, often fed by a river
words.name: lake

words.def: landscape ecology - an interdiscipline between ecology, botany, biogeography, physical geography and environmental planning
words.name: landscape ecology

words.def: large marine ecosystems- 64 global extensive coastal sea areas, indicated by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, where primary production and biomass are higher than in the open ocean
words.name: large marine ecosystems

words.def: lek mating - aggregation of male animals gathered to engage in competitive displays to entice females during the breeding season
words.name: lek mating

words.def: life form - an entity or being that is living
words.name: life form

words.def: limiting factor - any essential resource that is in short supply in a given environment
words.name: limiting factor

words.def: limnology- the study of inland waters, often regarded as forming part of ecology or of environmental science
words.name: limnology

words.def: logistic curve - an S shaped curve that usually represents growth of the population of a given species
words.name: logistic curve

words.def: Lotka–Volterra equation - mathematical equation used to describe the predator-prey interaction between two given species
words.name: Lotka–Volterra equation

words.def: macroecology - examines ecological phenomena at the largest possible scale
words.name: macroecology

words.def: mangrove wetland - mangroves are shrubs or small trees that grow in coastal saline or brackish water in the tropics and provide a habitat to many marine organisms
words.name: mangrove wetland

words.def: marine ecosystem (part of the aquatic ecosystem) - environment dominated and determined by the presence of saline water
words.name: marine ecosystem

words.def: marine snow - tiny particles, including dead organic matter from the upper layers of the ocean, sinking deep into the ocean
words.name: marine snow

words.def: mark and recapture - used to estimate populations and find survival rates, movement and growth
words.name: mark and recapture

words.def: mesopredator release hypothesis - hypothesis which states that as top predators dwindle in an ecosystem an increase in the different populations of mesopredators occurs
words.name: mesopredator release hypothesis

words.def: metabolic theory of ecology - theory that explains the relationship between an organism's body mass and metabolic rate
words.name: metabolic theory of ecology

words.def: microbial ecology - the ecology of micro-organisms
words.name: microbial ecology

words.def: micro-climate - a local set of atmospheric conditions that differ from those in the surrounding areas
words.name: micro-climate

words.def: microecology - the study of small scale ecological phenomena
words.name: microecology

words.def: migration - the movement of organisms from one place to another
words.name: migration

words.def: mimicry (in evolutionary biology) - a similarity of one species to another that protects one or both
words.name: mimicry

words.def: molecular ecology - a field of evolutionary biology concerned with applying molecular population genetics, molecular phylogenetics, and genomics to traditional ecological questions; essentially the same as ecological genetics
words.name: molecular ecology

words.def: monsoon - occurrence of seasonal changes in atmospheric circulation and precipitation
words.name: monsoon

words.def: mutualism - a form of symbiosis from which both individual organisms involved derive a fitness benefit
words.name: mutualism

words.def: natural resource - natural biotic and abiotic resources combined
words.name: natural resource

words.def: negative feedback loop - feedback that reduces the output of a system, for example when the temperature rises in a room, it turns off the thermostat so that the temperature remains stable
words.name: negative feedback loop

words.def: neutralism - belief that changes in evolution are caused by random mutation rather than by natural selection
words.name: neutralism

words.def: niche - a position or function of an organism in a community of related organisms
words.name: niche

words.def: niche differentiation see under "resource partitioning"
words.name: niche differentiation

words.def: nitrification - the oxidation of ammonia with oxygen into nitrite
words.name: nitrification

words.def: nitrogen cycle - a continuous cycle by which nitrogen from the atmosphere and compounded nitrogen keep getting exchanged through the soil into substances that can be taken up and used by green plants; what is left returns to the air as a result of denitrification
words.name: nitrogen cycle

words.def: nitrogen fixation - conversion of nitrogen into nitrogen compounds (ex. nitrate, nitrite), carried out naturally by certain bacteria and algae
words.name: nitrogen fixation

words.def: numerical response - the change in predator density as a function of change in prey density
words.name: numerical response

words.def: nutrient - chemical elements and compounds that provide organisms with the necessary nourishment.
words.name: nutrient

words.def: nutrient cycle - or ecological recycling - the movement and exchange of organic and inorganic matter back into the production of living matter
words.name: nutrient cycle

words.def: nutrient cycle efficiency - see under "ecosytem ecology"
words.name: nutrient cycle efficiency

words.def: ocean - body of salt water which covers almost 75% of Earth's surface
words.name: ocean

words.def: paleoecology - science that uses data from fossils to reconstruct the ecosystems of the past
words.name: paleoecology

words.def: parasite - an organism that depends for its survival on a symbiotic relationship with another organism —its host— which it does not usually kill directly but does negatively affect
words.name: parasite

words.def: parasitoid - an organism that is a parasite for most of its life and that will usually kill its host
words.name: parasitoid

words.def: permafrost - permanently frozen layer of terrain found beneath the arctic tundra
words.name: permafrost

words.def: pheromone - a chemical excreted into the environment as a signal, which causes a natural behavioral response in members of the same population
words.name: pheromone

words.def: phosphorus cycle - the biogeochemical cycle that describes the movement of phosphorus through the environment
words.name: phosphorus cycle

words.def: phytophysiognomy - overal physical characteristics of a plant community
words.name: phytophysiognomy

words.def: pioneer species - species that first inhabits a previously unoccupied environment
words.name: pioneer species

words.def: plant litter - the layer of dead plant material on the ground, providing a habitat to plants, micro organisms and animals; plays an important role in the nutrient cycle
words.name: plant litter

words.def: political ecology - studies how political and economic power affect the ecosystem, and vice versa how environmental factors influence social activity
words.name: political ecology

words.def: pollination - a type of fertilization in which pollen grains are transported through the air from one seed plant to the ovule-bearing organs of another seed plant. This transport is helped by either wind, water, or animal assistance
words.name: pollination

words.def: population density - the number of individuals of a species living in a defined area
words.name: population density

words.def: population distribution - see under "range"
words.name: population distribution

words.def: population ecology (or auto-ecology) - deals with the dynamics of populations within species, and the interactions of these populations with environmental factors
words.name: population ecology

words.def: population size - the number of individuals of a species in a particular population
words.name: population size

words.def: predator - an organism that lives by killing and consuming another living organism
words.name: predator

words.def: prey - living organisms that predators feed on
words.name: prey

words.def: primary production - production of organic compounds out of carbondioxide present in the atmosphere; all life on Earth directly or indirectly depends on it
words.name: primary production

words.def: producer or primary producer - an organism that makes its own food from inorganic material present in the environment, through photosynthesis, in the deep sea through chemosynthesis
words.name: producer

words.def: protocooperation - mutualism without necessity
words.name: protocooperation

words.def: quadrat (or "quad") - a rectangular plot of land extensively studied for its ecology
words.name: quadrat

words.def: rain shadow - arid or semi-arid climatical conditions of an area due to its position leeward of a mountain range
words.name: rain shadow

words.def: range - the range or distribution of a species in the geographical area within which that species can be foun
words.name: range

words.def: resource - a substance or object in the environment, required by an organism for its normal growth, maintenance, and reproduction
words.name: resource

words.def: resource partitioning - coexistence of two or more competing species that use the same natural resource but in different ways
words.name: resource partitioning

words.def: restoration ecology - attempts to understand the ecological basis needed to restore impaired or damaged ecosystems
words.name: restoration ecology

words.def: r-selected species - a species selected for its superiority in variable or unpredictable environments
words.name: r-selected species

words.def: run-off - the flow of water over land from rain, melting snow, or other sources
words.name: run-off

words.def: savanna - a tropical or subtropical grassland ecosystem with trees, but without a closed canopy
words.name: savanna

words.def: secondary succession - ecological succession that occurs after the original community has been destroyed or disturbed, as with a forest fire
words.name: secondary succession

words.def: selfish herd - individuals in a group acting together without planned direction
words.name: selfish herd

words.def: sexual selection - a trait that makes an individual organism more likely to find a mate than other members of its species; a microevolutionary process
words.name: sexual selection

words.def: sign stimulus - fixed action patterns such as mating dances
words.name: sign stimulus

words.def: social parasite see under "parasite"
words.name: social parasite

words.def: social behavior - behavior of an individual organism towards other members of the population of its species
words.name: social behavior

words.def: soil or pedosphere - the naturally occurring, unconsolidated or loose covering of Earth's surface
words.name: soil

words.def: soil ecology - the ecology of the pedosphere
words.name: soil ecology

words.def: song system - in songbirds a series of discrete brain nuclei used to learn and produce certain sequences
words.name: song system

words.def: source-sink dynamics - a theoretical model used by ecologists to describe how variation in habitat quality may affect the population growth or decline of organisms
words.name: source-sink dynamics

words.def: speciation - the evolutionary process through which new biological species come about
words.name: speciation

words.def: spring overturn - the mixing of lake water through the melting of ice cover, the warming of surface waters, convection currents, and wind action occurring in spring
words.name: spring overturn

words.def: stream - a flowing-water ecosystem that starts out as a freshwater spring or as melting snow
words.name: stream

words.def: survivorship curve - a graph showing the number or proportion of individuals surviving at each age for a given species
words.name: survivorship curve

words.def: symbiosis - a non predator - prey interaction between individuals of different species
words.name: symbiosis

words.def: temperate deciduous forest - see under "deciduous broadleaf forest"
words.name: temperate deciduous forest

words.def: territory - an area that one or more individual organisms defend against competition
words.name: territory

words.def: threat display - a signal used by individual organisms of certain species meaning that the user intends to attack
words.name: threat display

words.def: theoretical ecology - the development of ecological theory, usually with mathematical, statistical and/or computer modeling tools
words.name: theoretical ecology

words.def: trophic level - the position of an organism on the food chain — what it eats, and what eats it
words.name: trophic level

words.def: tropical rain forest - a biome characterized by regular, heavy rainfall, with a humidity of 80 plus percent, and great biodiversity
words.name: tropical rain forest

words.def: tundra - a permanently frozen, treeless expanse between the ice cap and tree line of arctic regions
words.name: tundra

words.def: umbrella species - species selected for making conservation related decisions, because protecting these species indirectly protects the many other species that make up the ecological community of its habitat
words.name: umbrella species

words.def: upwelling - wind-driven motion of cooler nutrient-rich ocean water towards the surface, stimulating the growth of phytoplankton
words.name: upwelling

words.def: urban ecology - the study of ecosystems in urban areas
words.name: urban ecology

words.def: vegetation - ground cover provided by plants
words.name: vegetation

words.def: vegetation formation - a concept used to classify vegetation communities
words.name: vegetation formation

words.def: vegetation type - see under "plant community"
words.name: vegetation type

words.def: virus - a microscopic infectious agent that replicates only within the living cell of other organisms
words.name: virus

words.def: warning coloration - a warning signal that prey uses to warn off predators
words.name: warning coloration

words.def: water cycle - (or hydrological cycle) the non-stop circulation of water on, above, and below Earth's surface. At different times during the cycle, water changes between its different states: liquid, vapor and ice
words.name: water cycle

words.def: water vapour - the gaseous state of water.
words.name: water vapour

words.def: watershed - the land where water from rain and melted snow drains downhill into a body of water (i.e. a river, lake, reservoir, estuary, wetland, sea, or ocean)
words.name: watershed

words.def: web of life - also known as the food chain, food network, or trophic social network. It describes the eating relationships between different species in a given ecosystem
words.name: web of life

words.def: wetland - distinct ecosystem consisting of land permanently or seasonally saturated with water; the habitat of aquatic plants
words.name: wetland

words.def: woodland - low-density forest
words.name: woodland

words.def: xeric - extremely dry
words.name: xeric

words.def: xerocole - animal adapted to desert life
words.name: xerocole

words.def: xerophyte - plant adapted to dry conditions
words.name: xerophyte

words.def: xylophagous - (organism) feeding on wood
words.name: xylophagous

words.def: yellow rain - a powdery, poisonous, yellow substance reported dropping from the air in southeast Asia and found to be the excrement of wild honeybees contaminated by a fungal toxin
words.name: yellow rain
